result.execSummary:
The defendant Fernando Lechuga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Remove Anti-Theft Device (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Communication confirming charges. signed 3/10/16

Defendant Fernando Lechuga in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Fernando Lechuga in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

 On motion of the State, Court ordered Count TWO:  Dismissed and read in.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve NINE MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for ZERO days time served. NO  Huber privileges.  Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and surcharges by 4-18-16 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Fernando Lechuga not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED  by the Court. Bail to remain the same. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Fernando Lechuga in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Fernando Lechuga in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Signature bond ordered forfeited. Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defendant not present.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued- remand to commissioner.

NOTE:  The Court VACATES Jury Trial date of 10-14-15 at 8:30 a.m. and recommends SIGNIFIGANT CASH BAIL due to cancellation of jury trial date**
